titleStmt.title: Description of Columbia University. MS Or 138: Collection of prayers and selections from the Qurʼān.

msContents.summary: Collection of prayers, excerpts from the Qurʼān and calligraphic illuminations.

msItem.title: Collection of prayers and selections from the Qurʼān.
[Collection of prayers and selections from the Qurʼān].

supportDesc.extent: ii + 40 + ii leaves : 150 x 105 (90 x 60) mm, bound to 150 x 105 x 10 mm

layoutDesc.layout: 9 lines generally forming an oval shape, border-ruled with corner decorations; several leaves have full page calligraphic illuminations.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Naskh in black ink; pointed, vocalized. Calligraphic lluminations and headers in thuluth.

decoNote: Polychrome and gold floral headpiece (f. 1v); floral sprays in gold, or green and pink or red in the corners of the textblock on each leaf shape the text to an oval; textblock border-ruled in black and gold; gold roundels punctuate the text. Circular or oval calligraphic panels set into a frame of gold with pink or blue highlights and floral sprays in the corners (f. 22v-26v).

binding.p: Brown leather with envelope flap with gold ruled border and floral central motif. Green, glossy, embossed doublure.

origin.p: Item is not dated, but likely produced in the 18th century.

history.provenance: Presumed to be a gift of David Eugene Smith, 1931-1934.
